contentrichtext.text: {{wiktionary|bata|bata-}} '''Bata''', '''Baťa''', '''Baţa''' or '''Batá''' may refer to: {{tocright}} ==Organizations== * [[Bata Shoes]], a multinational corporation * [[Bata Shoe Museum]], a museum of the history of footwear in Toronto ==Places== * [[Bata (village)]], a village in the municipality of Pomorie, Burgas Province, Bulgaria * [[Bata, Arad]], a commune in Arad County, Romania * Baţa, a village in [[Petru Rareș, Bistrița-Năsăud|Petru Rareş]] Commune, Bistrița-Năsăud County, Romania * [[Bata, Burgas Province]], a place in [[Burgas Province]], Bulgaria * [[Baťa Canal]], a canal in the Czech Republic * [[Bata, Equatorial Guinea]], the largest city in Equatorial Guinea * [[Bata, Pazardzhik Province]], a village in Bulgaria * Bata, the Greek and Genoese colony in Russia that became [[Novorossiysk]] * [[Bata Airport]], an airport in Equatorial Guinea ==People== * [[Bata (name)]] ==Other uses== * [[4318 Baťa]], asteroid named after the shoe company family * Bata, the cyprinid fish ''[[Labeo bata]]'' * [[Batá drum]], a double-headed drum shaped like an hourglass with one cone larger than the other * [[Bata (god)]], an Egyptian bull-god of the New Kingdom, * [[Bata (martial arts)]], a term used in Irish martial arts traditionally applied to various forms of stick fighting * [[Bata people]], people of [[North Province (Cameroon)|North Province]], Cameroon * [[Bata (tribe)]], a tribe in [[Bhawana]], Pakistan {{disambiguation|geo}}
